[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_proposal_msg.rs] [Function: verify()] [ProofCache consistency] The proof_cache at line 101 is shared across proposals - can concurrent verification of multiple proposals cause cache inconsistencies or race conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_proposal_msg.rs] [Function: verify()] [Duplicate proposal processing] Can the same OptProposalMsg be sent multiple times, passing verify() each time, causing validators to waste resources on duplicate verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_proposal_msg.rs] [Struct: OptProposalMsg] [PartialEq exploitation] The PartialEq implementation at line 12 enables equality checks - can attackers exploit this to create proposals that are equal but have different cryptographic validity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/opt_proposal_msg.rs] [Function: verify_well_formed()] [Cross-round replay] Can an attacker take a valid OptProposalMsg from round N and replay it at round N+2k (where k > 0) with modified round numbers that still satisfy the grandparent round check at lines 83-88?
